title.narrative: Ensuring girls’ WASH rights through MHM Promotion

description.narrative: WaterAid will support 29,419 schoolchildren and teachers gain access to inclusive water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) services enhancing gender equality in 104 schools in Nepal. Women and Girls at school and 9,753 members of the community will be empowered to manage menstruation hygienically and with dignity. This will include improved WASH facilities, raised awareness, affordable supply chains for sanitary materials and increased institutional accountability

mailing-address.narrative: Open data at WaterAid, 47-49 Durham Street, London, SE11 5JD, UK

title.narrative: Accountable Grant Arrangement for 'To Be A Girl' project

87,935 people in Nepal and Pakistan gain access to sustainable, inclusive WASH services including schoolgirls and teachers in 214 schools and women and girls in the community who are enabled to manage menstruation hygienically and with dignity.
